definition: commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: The order of commendation from the general headquarters lifted up still higher the morale of the troops.
sentences.chinese: 总司令部的嘉奖令大大地鼓舞了那个部队的士气。

sentences.english: The commander in chief specially lets the pantry arrange a silverfish thick soup, do you see to still make?
sentences.chinese: 总司令特别让厨房准备了一份银鱼羹，你看可还使得？

sentences.english: Which President was the first Commander-in-Chief of the U. S. Army and Navy?
sentences.chinese: 哪一位总统是美国第一任陆海军总司令？

sentences.english: A rider came pounding up with an order from the commander in chief.
sentences.chinese: 一个骑着马的人带着总司令的命令嗒嗒地飞奔而来。

sentences.english: The committee met with George Washington, head of the American Continental Army.
sentences.chinese: 委员会会见了和当时的美国大陆军总司令乔治华盛顿。

sentences.english: Critical moment, commander in chief calls, exempt from Chinese fir death, to assist.
sentences.chinese: 关键时刻，总司令来电，免除杉木死罪，降为少佐。

sentences.english: Commander-in-chief was mad cannot arrive hungrily .
sentences.chinese: 总司令是疯狂的无法饥饿地到达。

sentences.english: He soon succeeded joffre as commander-in-chief .
sentences.chinese: 他不久就接替霞飞担任总司令职务。

sentences.english: Chou Chih-jou was commander-in-chief of the Kuomintang's air force.
sentences.chinese: 周至柔，当时任国民党军空军总司令。

sentences.english: Xinjiang police commander in chief TaoShiYue effort to electrify uprising.
sentences.chinese: 新疆警备总司令陶峙岳率部通电起义。

sentences.english: Pai maneuvered himself into a strategic position in Central China and became commander of the government's defense at Hankow.
sentences.chinese: 白崇禧设法混到汉口担任华中剿匪总司令的要职。

sentences.english: He rendered a report to the commander-in-chief.
To all who serve, it has been the honor of my lifetime to be your Commander-in-Chief.
sentences.chinese: 我们的现役军官，成为你们的总司令是我一生的荣幸。

sentences.english: Gods be good, our Lord Commander's still in swaddling clothes.
sentences.chinese: 老天保佑，我们的总司令仍在襁褓当中。

sentences.english: They are going to move their general headquarters to Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算把总司令部搬到上海。

sentences.english: It is this rifleman who shot the enemy commander in chief .
sentences.chinese: 是这个步枪射手打死了敌方的总司令。

definition: Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee/same as 軍委|军委
air commodore/top commander of air force
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
